getMeanDegree 

get the mean degree of the graph. This is an undirected measure so inbound links add to a nodes degree.

title: Graphoscope
content:
(*** hide ***)

(*** condition: prepare ***)
#r "../src/Graphoscope/bin/Release/netstandard2.0/Graphoscope.dll"

(*** condition: ipynb ***)

#r "nuget: Graphoscope, {{fsdocs-package-version}}"
#endif // IPYNB

(**
# Graphoscope
 
[![Binder]({{root}}img/badge-binder.svg)](https://mybinder.org/v2/gh/plotly/plotly.net/gh-pages?urlpath=/tree/home/jovyan/{{fsdocs-source-basename}}.ipynb) 
[![Script]({{root}}img/badge-script.svg)]({{root}}{{fsdocs-source-basename}}.fsx) 
[![Notebook]({{root}}img/badge-notebook.svg)]({{root}}{{fsdocs-source-basename}}.ipynb)

A pragmatic approach to network science.

Here is how to use a function in the docs from the DLL built from the project:
*)

open Graphoscope

GraphPlaceholder.hello "world"
